intro: Phyllanthus orbiculatus var. acutifolius, commonly known as the acute-leaved globe spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, and is characterized by its rounded, fleshy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ornamental gardening and has traditional medicinal uses in some regions.
